titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: Another wet day. After breakfast I wrote letters to Linetta, and to some more confirmation boys. In the afternoon Archie Parker–Smith and I walked to Helensburgh & back. After dinner I read the 'Deerslayer' by Fennimore Cooper, indicating by my choice of literature the debased intellectual position into which I have fallen.
